Pre-Game Insights: Germany, leading their UEFA Nations League group, aim to edge closer to the quarter-finals when they face Bosnia-Herzegovina at the Bilino Polje Stadium in Zenica on Friday.
Germany have averaged 3.5 goals per game in the Nations League so far, creating an average of six big chances per match.
Bosnia-Herzegovina have conceded an average of 2.5 goals per game in the Nations League, including a 5-2 hammering by the Netherlands.
Germany have scored at least twice in six of their last eight matches.
Germany, led by Julian Nagelsmann, are sitting comfortably at the top of League A Group 3, having bagged four points from their opening two games.
Germany demolished Hungary 5-0 and followed it up with a 2-2 draw against the Netherlands.
Bosnia are languishing in third, having only one point to their name.
The big question heading into this encounter is whether Bosnia can capitalise on Germany’s somewhat weakened line-up, given the absence of key players like Kai Havertz, Jamal Musiala, and Leroy Sané.
